intro: Bigelowia pulchella, commonly known as the fairy duster, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. The plant produces small, white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Bigelowia pulchella thrives in dry, sunny environments and is often found in rocky soils along mountain slopes.
